revised_title: Experimental Method for Measuring Pressure in Detonation of High Explosives and Bullet Impact
tldr: The author presents a method to measure the pressure produced in the detonation of high explosives or by the impact of bullets. The method involves using a steel rod as a ballistic pendulum and measuring the momentum of the rod and the end-piece after impact. Experiments with lead bullets and gun-cotton show that the method can give accurate estimates of the maximum pressure and duration of very violent blows.
